WorkItem.ClosedComment:
As part of our move to GitHub, we're closing our CodePlex suggestions and asking that people move them to the GitHub issue tracker for further discussion.  Some feature requests may already be active on GitHub, so please make sure to look for an existing issue before filing a new one.

You can find our GitHub issue tracker here:
https://github.com/microsoft/typeScript/issues
WorkItem.Description:
Hello all!
Sorry if this has been asked before, I did a quick Google search and nothing remotely close to the issue I'm having is shown.

In lib.d.ts, `interface HTMLTableElement` contains a definition of `rows` as an `HTMLCollection`, this means that `HTMLTableElement.rows` does not contain a `cells` array element.

I know I can get around this by casting `HTMLTableElement.rows` to type `any` (or to another type) but I thought I'd point it out for the future :).

Cheers,

Griffork.
WorkItem.Summary: table.rows does not contain cells array

Comments.Message:
Here's a W3C example of how it works:

http://www.w3.org/TR/2013/REC-selectors-api-20130221/#examples
We can probably fix this (and other similar cases) more reasonably once generics are implemented
